algorithm_technique: Sort people by weight and use two pointers to pair the lightest with the heaviest.
problem_summary_simple: Find the minimum number of boats to save people, where each boat carries at most two people with a weight limit.
problem_summary_technical: Greedy approach using two pointers on a sorted array to pair the lightest person with the heaviest possible to minimize boat usage.
key_insights: The problem can be solved greedily by pairing the lightest person with the heaviest possible person.
Sorting the people array is essential for the greedy strategy to work.
Two pointers, one at the beginning (lightest) and one at the end (heaviest), efficiently find optimal pairings.
